titleInfo.title: Coll 5/35(1) ‘APPOINTMENT OF CIVIL AIR ATTACHÉ BAGDAD (WITH JURISDICTION OVER THE PERSIAN GULF)’

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 14; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence relating to the appointment of Beverley Gayer Barnard (1916-1973) as Civil Air Attaché at Baghdad, and the extension of his remit to cover the Persian Gulf.The main correspondents are as follows: the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf (Sir William Rupert Hay), officials of the Commonwealth Relations Office (Ralph Ingham Hallows and Eion Pelly Donaldson), and the Foreign Office (Alastair George Maitland).The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
